oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civilian Conservation Corps promotion certificate for Charles Edward Rutherford to assistant leader
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Certificate acknowledging Charles Edward Rutherford's promotion to Assistant Leader for Civilian Conservation Corps, Company 417, by Joseph C. Matthews, Jr., Capt. 321st Infantry, Commanding Co. 417, CCC.

The Civilian Conservation Corps was created by Congress in 1937 to succeeed the Emergency Conservation program begun in 1933. Remedial education and vocational training programs were added later. The; mission of the CCC was to provide work for unemployed young people. The CCC built roads, homes, and furniture, and it was instrumental in the infrastructure of the Tennessee State Parks system and National Parks in Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
Certificates
